Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. Response: Corporate social responsibility is no longer a philanthropic afterthought, it is a strategic necessity in todays interconnected world. As companies grow in influence, their impact on society, the environment, and the economy becomes more pronounced. Corporate social responsibility recognises that business are not isolated economic units, but integral parts of the community they serve. As its core, Corporate social responsibility is about accountability, it challenges companies to go beyond profit making and consider the broader implications of their actions. Whether its reducing carbon emissions, ensuring ethical behaviours and labore practices, or inverting in the community development, socially responsible companies build trust and long term values, This in turn enhances brand reputations, attracts top talent, and secures customer loyalty. Moreover, Corporate social responsibility is not just morally sound, it makes business sense. consumers are increasingly aligning their spending with their values and investors are prioritizing environmental social and governance factors. A company that neglects Corporate social responsibility risks reputational damage and diminished competitiveness. In emerging markets, Corporate social responsibility can be a transforming force, corporations have the resources to address systematic challenges such as poverty, inequality, educational gaps often more effectively than goverments. In sum Corporate social responsibility should not be viewed as a cost but as an investment Correction: Corporate social responsibility is no longer a philanthropic afterthought, it is a strategic necessity in todays interconnected world. As companies grow in influence, their impact on society, the environment, and the economy becomes more pronounced. Corporate social responsibility recognises that business are not isolated economic units, but integral parts of the community they serve. As its core, Corporate social responsibility is about accountability, it challenges companies to go beyond profitmaking and consider the broader implications of their actions. Whether its reducing carbon emissions, ensuring ethical behaviours and labore practices, or inverting in the community development, socially responsible companies build trust and longterm value, This in turnenhances brand reputations, attracts top talent, and secures customer loyalty. Moreover, Corporate social responsibility is not just morally sound, it makes business sense. consumers are increasingly aligning their spending with their valuesand investors are prioritizing environmentalsocialand governance factors. A company that neglects Corporate social responsibility risks reputational damage and diminished competitiveness. In emerging markets, Corporate social responsibility can be a transforming force, corporations have the resources to address systematic challenges such as poverty, inequality, educational gaps often more effectively than goverments. In sum Corporate social responsibility should not be viewed as a cost but as an investmen

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: You work for an electronics company and are preparing a speech for a celebration dinner. Include a greeting/opening, a part where you show thanks, and a conclusion where you try to motivate the staff. Type in the input box. Write 125â€“200 words. Response: Good evening, everyone. Thank you for taking time out of your busy schedule to join us. Today's event is held to celebrate you all for hard working everyday. Please enjoy this party. Before starting a party, please let me express my gratitude. First of all, again, our company is supported by you all, so please let me say that "thank you so much everyday". and please let me introduce a quote. Thomas Edison said 'There's no substitute for hard work.' For our view, this means that there really are no short cuts in our industry, and success only comes with hard work. So our company exists thanks to you all. That's all from me. Well, let's get started a party and enjoy a dinner. Correction: Good evening, everyone. Thank you for taking time out of your busy schedule to join us. Today's event is held to celebrate you all for hard working everyday. Please enjoy this party. Before starting a party, please let me express my gratitude. First of all, again, our company is supported by you all, so please let me say that "thank you so much everyday". and please let me introduce a quote. Thomas Edison said 'There's no substitute for hard work.' For our view, this means that there really are no short cuts in our industry, and success only comes with hard work. So our company exists thanks to you all. That's all from me. Well, let's get started a party and enjoy a dinner.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your friend is about to open a secondhand clothes shop. He doesnâ€™t have much capital, and is renting a very old building. He has got a few quotes for property and liability insurance, but they have been very high. He asks you to do a risk assessment of the premises. Have a look at your checklist, then write him an email advising him of the changes he has to make. Write 150-200 words. Response: Hi Friend,

Iâ€™ve gone through the risk assessment for your secondhand clothes shop, and based on the checklist, here are a few changes you can make to help lower your property and liability insurance premiums.

Building Condition: Since the building is old, it might be increasing your premiums. Consider investing in some basic repairs, especially for plumbing and electrical systems. Insurance companies often view buildings with outdated infrastructure as higher risks.

Security: Installing security systems like an alarm, CCTV, and better locks will lower the risk of theft and vandalism. Many insurers offer discounts for properties with enhanced security measures.

Fire Safety: Adding fire extinguishers, smoke detectors, and possibly sprinklers could help reduce the risk of fire-related claims. These improvements may also make your insurance premiums more manageable.

Liability Coverage: Since the building is older, consider limiting your liability coverage to match the size and layout of the premises. If possible, raise your deductible to reduce premiums.

Let me know if you need help coordinating any of these changes!

Sohee Kim Correction: <input>Hi Friend,

Iâ€™ve gone through the risk assessment for your secondhand clothes shop, and based on the checklist, here are a few changes you can make to help lower your property and liability insurance premiums.

Building Condition: Since the building is old, it might be increasing your premiums. Consider investing in some basic repairs, especially for plumbing and electrical systems. Insurance companies often view buildings with outdated infrastructure as higher risks.

Security: Installing security systems like an alarm, CCTV, and better locks will lower the risk of theft and vandalism. Many insurers offer discounts for properties with enhanced security measures.

Fire Safety: Adding fire extinguishers, smoke detectors, and possibly sprinklers could help reduce the risk of fire-related claims. These improvements may also make your insurance premiums more manageable.

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Last weekend, my friend Miguel had an interesting encounter during his hike in the hills that are near our town. As he was following one of his usual trails, he saw a path he hadn't seen before, covered by overgrown bushes. Very intrigued, Miguel decided to explore the new route. The path led to a small clearing where Miguel found an old, weathered bench. It looked like it hadn't been used in years, but it offered a perfect spot to sit and enjoy the surroundings. While resting there, Miguel noticed a bird's nest in the branches above, filled with chirping baby birds. He watched them for a while, fascinated by the miracle of nature. After the little break, Miguel continued down the trail, which eventually looped back to a part of the forest he recognized. On his way back, he chatted with a fellow hiker who mentioned that the bench was part of a forgotten birdwatching spot that locals used to visit years ago. Alex returned home with a renewed appreciation for the small surprises nature can offer. His unexpected discovery reminded him that sometimes taking a different path can lead to unexpected experiences. Correction: Last weekend, my friend Miguel had an interesting encounter during his hike in the hills that are near our town. As he was following one of his usual trails, he saw a path he hadn't seen before, covered by overgrown bushes. Very intrigued, Miguel decided to explore the new route. The path led to a small clearing where Miguel found an old, weathered bench. It looked like it hadn't been used in years, but it offered a perfect spot to sit and enjoy the surroundings. While resting there, Miguel noticed a bird's nest in the branches above, filled with chirping baby birds. He watched them for a while, fascinated by the miracle of nature. After the little break, Miguel continued down the trail, which eventually looped back to a part of the forest he recognized. On his way back, he chatted with a fellow hiker who mentioned that the bench was part of a forgotten birdwatching spot that locals used to visit years ago. Alex returned home with a renewed appreciation for the small surprises nature can offer. His unexpected discovery reminded him that sometimes taking a different path can lead to unexpected experiences.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Summarize the report, using your own words. Write 8-10 lines. Compare your text with the model. Response: On June 13, 2010, InterStar Airways Flight 293 landed safely at San Francisco International Airport with its nose wheels turned 90 degrees. The flight, which was originally headed from Oakland to Phoenix, encountered an error message related to the nose landing gear shock absorber shortly after departure. Diverting first to San Jose for a visual check, it was confirmed that the nose gear was misaligned. The captain then chose San Francisco for landing due to its longer runway and better emergency services. To reduce landing weight, the plane flew for several hours to burn fuel. The captain instructed the cabin crew on emergency procedures, advising evacuation from the rear if necessary. During the landing, the aircraft's tires deflated but the plane remained on the runway centerline. No injuries occurred, and passengers deplaned normally. Correction: On June 13, 2010, InterStar Airways Flight 293 landed safely at San Francisco International Airport with its nose wheels turned 90 degrees. The flight, which was originally headed from Oakland to Phoenix, encountered an error message related to the nose landing gear shock absorber shortly after departure. Diverting first to San Jose for a visual check, it was confirmed that the nose gear was misaligned. The captain then chose San Francisco for landing due to its longer runway and better emergency services. To reduce landing weight, the plane flew for several hours to burn fuel. The captain instructed the cabin crew on emergency procedures, advising evacuation from the rear if necessary. During the landing, the aircraft's tires deflated but the plane remained on the runway centerline. No injuries occurred, and passengers deplaned normally.

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. Response: Language learning is a rewarding but often challenging journey. Students frequently face difficulties that range from pronunciation struggles to mastering grammar and vocabulary retention. One common issue is overcoming the fear of making mistakes. Many learners hesitate to speak because they worry about errors, which can hinder their progress. Confidence-building exercises, such as practicing with native speakers or engaging in conversations, help students gain fluency. Another challenge is understanding cultural nuances. Language is deeply tied to culture, and learners may struggle with idioms, slang, or expressions that donâ€™t directly translate. Exposure to authentic materials, such as movies, books, and conversations, enhances cultural comprehension. Additionally, memorizing vocabulary and grammar rules can be daunting. Rote learning often fails to stick, so students benefit from active learning techniques, such as writing practice, using words in context, and spaced repetition systems. Consistency is also crucialâ€”many learners start with enthusiasm but struggle with maintaining a regular study schedule. Setting achievable goals and incorporating language learning into daily routines can help sustain progress. By addressing these challenges with patience and persistence, students can improve their proficiency and enjoy the process of mastering a new language. Would you like suggestions on effective study strategies? Correction: Language learning is a rewarding but often challenging journey. Students frequently face difficulties that range from pronunciation struggles to mastering grammar and vocabulary retention. One common issue is overcoming the fear of making mistakes. Many learners hesitate to speak because they worry about errors, which can hinder their progress. Confidence-building exercises, such as practicing with native speakers or engaging in conversations, help students gain fluency. Another challenge is understanding cultural nuances. Language is deeply tied to culture, and learners may struggle with idioms, slang, or expressions that donâ€™t directly translate. Exposure to authentic materials, such as movies, books, and conversations, enhances cultural comprehension. Additionally, memorizing vocabulary and grammar rules can be daunting. Rote learning often fails to stick, so students benefit from active learning techniques, such as writing practice, using words in context, and spaced repetition systems. Consistency is also crucialâ€”many learners start with enthusiasm but struggle with maintaining a regular study schedule. Setting achievable goals and incorporating language learning into daily routines can help sustain progress. By addressing these challenges with patience and persistence, students can improve their proficiency and enjoy the process of mastering a new language. Would you like suggestions on effective study strategies?

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Write a summary of no more than 50-60 words about the case. Use the words below. This is a non-graded activity. Response: The jury was initially split, with eight jurors voting to convict defendants on charges of both the conspiracy and intent to incite riots, and four jurors voting to acquit the defendants on all charges. The foreman handed a hung-jury message to the marshal to take to the judge, but he instructed the jury to keep deliberating. In the end, on February 18, 1970, all seven defendants were found not guilty on the conspiracy charges, two were acquitted completely, and five were convicted of inciting to riot. These five were each sentenced to five years' imprisonment and fined $5,000 on February 20, 1970. The convictions were all reversed on appeal by the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit on November 21, 1972. The reasons for the reversal involved bias by the judge and his refusal to permit defense attorneys to question prospective jurors regarding cultural bias. The Justice Department decided not to re-try the case. During the trial, all the defendants and both defense attorneys were cited for contempt and sentenced to jail, but those convictions were also overturned. The contempt charges were re-tried before a different judge, who found four people guilty of some of the charges, but decided not to sentence the defendants to jail or fines. Correction: The jury was initially split, with eight jurors voting to convict defendants on charges of both the conspiracy and intent to incite riots, and four jurors voting to acquit the defendants on all charges. The foreman handed a hung-jury message to the marshal to take to the judge, but he instructed the jury to keep deliberating. In the end, on February 18, 1970, all seven defendants were found not guilty on the conspiracy charges, two were acquitted completely, and five were convicted of inciting to riot. These five were each sentenced to five years' imprisonment and fined $5,000 on February 20, 1970. The convictions were all reversed on appeal by the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit on November 21, 1972. The Justice Department decided not to re-try the case. During the trial, all the defendants and both defense attorneys were cited for contempt and sentenced to jail, but those convictions were also overturned. The contempt charges were re-tried before a different judge, who found four people guilty of some of the charges, but decided not to sentence the defendants to jail or fines.

Prompt Level: 12.0 Prompt: Write about how to develop leadership qualities. You can write about personal experiences or what you have seen happen in others. Response: Developing leadership qualities involves a combination of self-awareness, communication skills, and continuous learning. To start, leaders must develop emotional intelligence by recognizing their own emotions and understanding others' feelings. This helps in building strong, empathetic relationships. Effective communication is crucial, as it ensures leaders can convey ideas clearly, listen actively, and inspire teams. A good leader also demonstrates decision-making abilities, balancing risks and rewards, and taking responsibility for outcomes. Problem-solving skills are key, as leaders often face challenges that require creative solutions. Additionally, strong leaders are adaptable and open to feedback, constantly striving to improve themselves and their teams. Developing leadership also includes fostering teamwork, providing mentorship, and encouraging others to take initiative. By setting an example of integrity, resilience, and accountability, leaders build trust and create a positive, motivating environment. Ultimately, leadership development is a lifelong journey of growth and self-improvement. That is all it. Correction: Developing leadership qualities involves a combination of self-awareness, communication skills, and continuous learning. To start, leaders must develop emotional intelligence by recognizing their own emotions and understanding others' feelings. This helps in building strong, empathetic relationships. Effective communication is crucial, as it ensures leaders can convey ideas clearly, listen actively, and inspire teams. A good leader also demonstrates decision-making abilities, balancing risks and rewards, and taking responsibility for outcomes. Problem-solving skills are key, as leaders often face challenges that require creative solutions. Additionally, strong leaders are adaptable and open to feedback, constantly striving to improve themselves and their teams. Developing leadership also includes fostering teamwork, providing mentorship, and encouraging others to take initiative. By setting an example of integrity, resilience, and accountability, leaders build trust and create a positive, motivating environment. Ultimately, leadership development is a lifelong journey of growth and self-improvement. That is all it.

The wings help the airplane to fly. They help to move forward and to generate lift to go up and down. They have flaps that help to control speed. The cockpit is where the pilot is and where all the necessary stuff is located to control the airplane. Things like flight instruments, communications radio, and the seating area are part of this part. The airplane engine is the power source. This is an electric engine that needs fuel normally located inside the wings. The tail located at the rear position provides stability and direction. Landing gear is used for takeoff and landing or during taxi. They have wheels and have a retractable system. For monitoring using radars, the transponder is the mechanism to transmit and receive signals to determine position and altitude. Landing gear is used for takeoff and landing or during taxi. They have wheels and have a retractable system. For monitoring using radars, the transponder is the mechanism to transmit and receive signals to determine position and altitude.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: An airplane consists of several key parts that work together to ensure it can fly safely and efficiently. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane, providing space for passengers, cargo, and the cockpit where the pilots control the aircraft. It also serves as a structural frame that holds the other parts in place.

The wings are crucial for flight. They generate lift by moving air faster over the top surface than the bottom, creating an upward force that allows the plane to stay in the air. The shape and angle of the wings are carefully designed to provide the most efficient lift.

The tail of the airplane, also known as the empennage, consists of the horizontal stabilizer and the vertical stabilizer. The horizontal stabilizer helps to keep the plane level and prevent pitching, while the vertical stabilizer controls the planeâ€™s yaw, or side-to-side movement.

Finally, the engines provide the thrust needed for the airplane to move forward. Most commercial airplanes use jet engines that take in air, compress it, mix it with fuel, and then expel it at high speed to propel the aircraft forward.

Each of these parts works together to ensure the airplane can fly smoothly and safely. Correction: <input>An airplane consists of several key parts that work together to ensure it can fly safely and efficiently. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane, providing space for passengers, cargo, and the cockpit where the pilots control the aircraft. It also serves as a structural frame that holds the other parts in place.

The wings are crucial for flight. They generate lift by moving air faster over the top surface than the bottom, creating an upward force that allows the plane to stay in the air. The shape and angle of the wings are carefully designed to provide the most efficient lift.

The tail of the airplane, also known as the empennage, consists of the horizontal stabilizer and the vertical stabilizer. The horizontal stabilizer helps to keep the plane level and prevent pitching, while the vertical stabilizer controls the planeâ€™s yaw, or side-to-side movement.

Finally, the engines provide the thrust needed for the airplane to move forward. Most commercial airplanes use jet engines that take in air, compress it, mix it with fuel, and then expel it at high speed to propel the aircraft forward.

Each of these parts works together to ensure the airplane can fly smoothly and safely.</input>

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. Response: Language students often encounter a variety of issues and challenges that can impede their learning process. What are the most common difficulties they face, and how can these be addressed?

Firstly, language learners frequently struggle with pronunciation and accents. The phonetic differences between their native language and the target language can lead to misunderstandings and communication barriers. This challenge can be mitigated through practice and exposure to native speakers, as well as utilizing language learning tools that focus on pronunciation.

Another significant issue is the complexity of grammar and syntax. Language students often find it difficult to grasp the rules and structures of a new language, which can be vastly different from their own. To overcome this, learners can benefit from structured lessons and exercises that incrementally build their understanding, alongside practical application in conversations and writing.

Vocabulary acquisition is also a hurdle, as memorizing and retaining new words can be overwhelming. Students can address this challenge by using mnemonic devices, engaging in immersive experiences, and employing spaced repetition techniques to reinforce memory.

Additionally, cultural nuances and idiomatic expressions pose challenges, as language is deeply intertwined with culture. Students may struggle to understand context or use language appropriately. Exposure to authentic materials such as films, books, and interactions with native speakers can help bridge this gap.

Finally, motivation and confidence are crucial yet fragile elements. Language learning is a long-term commitment that requires perseverance. Encouragement from peers, setting achievable goals, and celebrating small victories can sustain motivation and boost confidence.

In summary, language students face numerous challenges, but with strategic approaches and consistent effort, these obstacles can be overcome, leading to successful language acquisition. Correction: <input>Language students often encounter a variety of issues and challenges that can impede their learning process. What are the most common difficulties they face, and how can these be addressed?

Firstly, language learners frequently struggle with pronunciation and accents. The phonetic differences between their native language and the target language can lead to misunderstandings and communication barriers. This challenge can be mitigated through practice and exposure to native speakers, as well as utilizing language learning tools that focus on pronunciation.

Another significant issue is the complexity of grammar and syntax. Language students often find it difficult to grasp the rules and structures of a new language, which can be vastly different from their own. To overcome this, learners can benefit from structured lessons and exercises that incrementally build their understanding, alongside practical application in conversations and writing.

Vocabulary acquisition is also a hurdle, as memorizing and retaining new words can be overwhelming. Students can address this challenge by using mnemonic devices, engaging in immersive experiences, and employing spaced repetition techniques to reinforce memory.

Additionally, cultural nuances and idiomatic expressions pose challenges, as language is deeply intertwined with culture. Students may struggle to understand context or use language appropriately. Exposure to authentic materials such as films, books, and interactions with native speakers can help bridge this gap.

Finally, motivation and confidence are crucial yet fragile elements. Language learning is a long-term commitment that requires perseverance. Encouragement from peers, setting achievable goals, and celebrating small victories can sustain motivation and boost confidence.

In summary, language students face numerous challenges, but with strategic approaches and consistent effort, these obstacles can be overcome, leading to successful language acquisition.</input>

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. Response: Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) has become an integral part of modern business practices, reflecting a company's commitment to ethical behavior, sustainable development, and community engagement. The postings on this topic reveal a spectrum of opinions, ranging from enthusiastic support to skeptical criticism.

Proponents argue that CSR initiatives foster a positive public image, enhance customer loyalty, and attract top talent. Companies like Patagonia and Ben & Jerry's are often cited as exemplars, demonstrating that ethical practices can coexist with profitability. These businesses have successfully integrated environmental stewardship and social equity into their core operations, proving that CSR can be a win-win strategy for both the company and society.

Critics, however, contend that CSR is often a facade, a marketing gimmick designed to distract from less savory business practices. They point to instances where companies engage in "greenwashing," promoting environmentally friendly initiatives while continuing harmful practices behind the scenes. This skepticism underscores the need for transparency and accountability in CSR efforts.

In my view, CSR is not just a moral imperative but a strategic necessity in today's interconnected world. Companies wield significant influence and resources, and with that comes the responsibility to contribute positively to society. Effective CSR requires genuine commitment, clear goals, and measurable outcomes. It should be embedded in the company's culture and operations, rather than being treated as an afterthought or a mere public relations tool.

Ultimately, the true measure of CSR's success lies in its impact. When done right, CSR can drive meaningful change, fostering a more sustainable and equitable world while also benefiting the business itself. Therefore, companies should strive to move beyond superficial gestures and embrace CSR as a core component of their identity and strategy. Correction: <input>Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) has become an integral part of modern business practices, reflecting a company's commitment to ethical behavior, sustainable development, and community engagement. The postings on this topic reveal a spectrum of opinions, ranging from enthusiastic support to skeptical criticism.

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade pact signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States, which came into effect on January 1, 1994. NAFTA aimed to eliminate most tariffs and trade barriers between the three countries, creating one of the largest free-trade zones in the world. The agreement was inspired by the success of the European Economic Community and sought to boost economic growth and job creation through increased trade and investment. NAFTA's main provisions included the gradual reduction of tariffs, customs duties, and other trade barriers over a period of up to 15 years. This allowed for duty-free access to a wide range of goods and services, fostering economic integration among the member countries. The agreement also included side agreements on labor and environmental standards to address concerns about the potential negative impacts of increased trade. Despite facing significant opposition and political debates, NAFTA was generally seen as beneficial for the North American economies. It facilitated the flow of goods, services, and capital, contributing to economic growth and higher living standards. However, it also had its critics, who argued that it led to job losses in certain industries exposed to trade competition. In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which aimed to modernize and update the trade relationship between the three countries. Correction: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade pact signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States, which came into effect on January 1, 1994. NAFTA aimed to eliminate most tariffs and trade barriers between the three countries, creating one of the largest free-trade zones in the world. The agreement was inspired by the success of the European Economic Community and sought to boost economic growth and job creation through increased trade and investment. NAFTA's main provisions included the gradual reduction of tariffs, customs duties, and other trade barriers over a period of up to 15 years. This allowed for duty-free access to a wide range of goods and services, fostering economic integration among the member countries. The agreement also included side agreements on labor and environmental standards to address concerns about the potential negative impacts of increased trade. Despite facing significant opposition and political debates, NAFTA was generally seen as beneficial for the North American economies. It facilitated the flow of goods, services, and capital, contributing to economic growth and higher living standards. However, it also had its critics, who argued that it led to job losses in certain industries exposed to trade competition. In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which aimed to modernize and update the trade relationship between the three countries.

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. Response: Language learning can be a rewarding yet challenging journey. Students often face several issues and challenges that can hinder their progress. **What are the common difficulties in language learning?** One major challenge is **pronunciation**. Many students struggle with mastering the sounds and intonation patterns of a new language, which can lead to misunderstandings. **How does grammar affect language learning?** Grammar rules can be complex and different from the student's native language, making it difficult to construct sentences correctly. **What role does vocabulary play?** Building a robust vocabulary is essential, but memorizing new words and their meanings can be overwhelming. **How do cultural differences impact learning?** Cultural nuances and idiomatic expressions can be confusing and hard to grasp. **What about motivation and confidence?** Maintaining motivation and confidence is crucial; students often feel discouraged by slow progress or fear of making mistakes. **How can practice opportunities be limited?** Limited opportunities to practice speaking with native speakers can impede fluency development. Addressing these challenges requires patience, consistent practice, and sometimes seeking additional resources or support from teachers and peers. Correction: Language learning can be a rewarding yet challenging journey. Students often face several issues and challenges that can hinder their progress. **What are the common difficulties in language learning?** One major challenge is **pronunciation**. Many students struggle with mastering the sounds and intonation patterns of a new language, which can lead to misunderstandings. **How does grammar affect language learning?** Grammar rules can be complex and different from the student's native language, making it difficult to construct sentences correctly. **What role does vocabulary play?** Building a robust vocabulary is essential, but memorizing new words and their meanings can be overwhelming. **How do cultural differences impact learning?** Cultural nuances and idiomatic expressions can be confusing and hard to grasp. **What about motivation and confidence?** Maintaining motivation and confidence is crucial; students often feel discouraged by slow progress or fear of making mistakes. **How can practice opportunities be limited?** Limited opportunities to practice speaking with native speakers can impede fluency development. Addressing these challenges requires patience, consistent practice, and sometimes seeking additional resources or support from teachers and peers.

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) is a major trade pact between the United States, Canada, and Mexico. After lengthy negotiations, it officially came into effect in January 1994. Its main goal was to reduce or eliminate customs duties and other trade barriers between the three countries, thereby encouraging the free flow of goods and services across borders. NAFTA has had a significant impact on trade relations, particularly in sectors like agriculture and manufacturing. For example, it allowed Mexican fruits and vegetables to enter the U.S. market more easily, benefiting both producers and consumers. It also helped integrate supply chains across North America, making industries more competitive globally. However, the agreement has not been without controversy. While it created jobs and boosted exports in some regions, it also led to job losses and factory closures in others. Despite these challenges, NAFTA has generally been seen as beneficial for all three member countries, strengthening economic ties and promoting regional cooperation. Correction: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) is a major trade pact between the United States, Canada, and Mexico. After lengthy negotiations, it officially came into effect in January 1994. Its main goal was to reduce or eliminate customs duties and other trade barriers between the three countries, thereby encouraging the free flow of goods and services across borders. NAFTA has had a significant impact on trade relations, particularly in sectors like agriculture and manufacturing. For example, it allowed Mexican fruits and vegetables to enter the U.S. market more easily, benefiting both producers and consumers. It also helped integrate supply chains across North America, making industries more competitive globally. However, the agreement has not been without controversy. While it created jobs and boosted exports in some regions, it also led to job losses and factory closures in others. Despite these challenges, NAFTA has generally been seen as beneficial for all three member countries, strengthening economic ties and promoting regional cooperation.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Summarize the report, using your own words. Write 8-10 lines. Compare your text with the model. Response: On June 13, 2010, InterStar Airways Flight 293 landed safely in San Francisco with its nose wheels turned sideways. The plane originally took off from Oakland to Phoenix with 141 passengers and no problems at first. The crew saw error messages about the nose landing gear and steering. They flew by the control tower in San Jose, which confirmed the nose wheels were facing the wrong way. The captain chose San Francisco for landing due to its better emergency support and longer runway. To make the landing safer, the crew flew around to burn fuel and reduce weight. Passengers were told about the gear issue and evacuation plans in case of an emergency. The captain landed the plane carefully, avoiding reverse thrust and using normal brakes. Tires tore apart during landing, but the plane stayed straight on the runway. No one was hurt, and passengers exited safely the aircraft using an air stair. They flew by the control tower in San Jose, which confirmed the nose wheels were facing the wrong way. Tires tore apart during landing, but the plane stayed straight on the runway. No one was hurt, and passengers exited safely the aircraft using an air stair.

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: To create a motivated, engaged, and productive workforce, it is vital for leaders to take a strategic approach that aligns employees' personal and professional growth with the company's goals. By incentivizing employees and linking their success directly to the company's achievements, managers can create a sense of ownership and motivation, where individuals feel that their contributions directly impact their rewards and overall success. Additionally, taking an active interest in employees' career development and offering mentorship opportunities fosters a deeper connection between the individual and the organization, ensuring they feel supported in their professional journey. Providing opportunities for ongoing training and skill development ensures that employees are equipped with the tools they need to thrive, creating a culture of continuous improvement. It's equally important to promote a healthy work-life balance by recognizing that employees have lives outside of the workplace, and showing empathy toward their personal commitments will build loyalty and well-being. Listening actively to employees, especially when they raise concerns or express dissatisfaction, not only helps to address potential issues early on but also fosters a culture of trust where employees feel heard and valued. Acknowledging their contributions, celebrating their achievements, and giving credit where it's due motivates individuals to perform at their best. On the flip side, behaviors that demotivate employees, such as disrespecting them, taking credit for their work, losing one's temper, unfairly placing blame, or failing to provide recognition for good work, can severely harm morale, leading to disengagement and decreased productivity. It's essential to remember that the actions and attitudes of leadership directly influence the overall atmosphere within a company, and creating a positive, supportive, and respectful environment is the foundation for achieving long-term success. Correction: To create a motivated, engaged, and productive workforce, it is vital for leaders to take a strategic approach that aligns employees' personal and professional growth with the company's goals. By incentivizing employees and linking their success directly to the company's achievements, managers can create a sense of ownership and motivation, where individuals feel that their contributions directly impact their rewards and overall success. Additionally, taking an active interest in employees' career development and offering mentorship opportunities fosters a deeper connection between the individual and the organization, ensuring they feel supported in their professional journey. Providing opportunities for ongoing training and skill development ensures that employees are equipped with the tools they need to thrive, creating a culture of continuous improvement. It's equally important to promote a healthy work-life balance by recognizing that employees have lives outside of the workplace, and showing empathy toward their personal commitments will build loyalty and well-being. Listening actively to employees, especially when they raise concerns or express dissatisfaction, not only helps to address potential issues early on but also fosters a culture of trust where employees feel heard and valued. Acknowledging their contributions, celebrating their achievements, and giving credit where it's due motivates individuals to perform at their best. On the flip side, behaviors that demotivate employees, such as disrespecting them, taking credit for their work, losing one's temper, unfairly placing blame, or failing to provide recognition for good work, can severely harm morale, leading to disengagement and decreased productivity. It's essential to remember that the actions and attitudes of leadership directly influence the overall atmosphere within a company, and creating a positive, supportive, and respectful environment is the foundation for achieving long-term success.

Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: An airplane has many important parts that help it fly safely and efficiently. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane. It holds the passengers, cargo, and the cockpit where the pilots sit. The fuselage is strong and shaped to reduce air resistance. The wings are attached to the fuselage and are very important for flying. They create lift, which helps the airplane rise into the air. Wings also have flaps and ailerons that help the pilot control the planeâ€™s movement during takeoff, flight, and landing. The tail of the airplane includes the vertical and horizontal stabilizers. These parts keep the airplane stable and help control its direction. The vertical stabilizer helps the airplane turn left or right, while the horizontal stabilizer controls the up and down movement. Finally, the engines provide the power needed for the airplane to move forward. They push or pull the plane through the air and help it gain speed for takeoff and maintain speed during flight. All these parts work together to make flying possible and safe. Correction: An airplane has many important parts that help it fly safely and efficiently. Polite Tone: Maintain a courteous and respectful tone throughout. - Proofread: Check for spelling, grammar, and punctuation errors. - Relevant Attachments: Ensure all necessary files are attached. - Appropriate Closing: Use a professional closing like "Best regards" or "Sincerely". - Contact Information: Include your contact information for any follow-up. - Follow-Up: If no response is received in a reasonable time, consider sending a polite follow-up email. Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Review your notes and write a case report stating who was found guilty and why. Briefly comment on whether you found the verdict appropriate. Write 150-200 words. Response: Case Overview: This case involves a tort action for trespassing where the plaintiff, Byron, accused the defendant, Medina, of unlawfully entering their home. The incident caused significant distress and terror to the Byron family. It was unclear whether Medina took any valuables, as there was no specific mention of items being stolen.

Details of the Case:

Plaintiff's Position: Medina unlawfully entered the Byron family home, causing distress and terror.
Defendant's Position: Medina claimed he believed the house was empty and was seeking shelter at night. He admitted to ransacking the house in the process.
Verdict: The court found Medina guilty of trespassing, a criminal offense. The penalties imposed included a fine of $1,000, to be paid in two installments, with one payment to be made immediately. Additionally, Medina was sentenced to complete 300 hours of community service.

Commentary on the Verdict: The verdict appears appropriate given the circumstances of the case. Trespassing is a criminal offense, and the court's decision to impose a monetary fine and community service is a reasonable punishment for Medina's unlawful entry and the distress caused to the Byron family. The sentencing takes into account Medina's actions while providing a rehabilitative component through community service, which may deter similar behavior in the future. The fine and community service collectively serve as a punitive measure and a means of restitution for the disturbance caused by the trespass. The incident caused significant distress and terror to the Byron family. It was unclear whether Medina took any valuables, as there was no specific mention of items being stolen.

Details of the Case:

Verdict: The court found Medina guilty of trespassing, a criminal offense. The penalties imposed included a fine of $1,000, to be paid in two installments, with one payment to be made immediately. Additionally, Medina was sentenced to complete 300 hours of community service.

Commentary on the Verdict: The verdict appears appropriate given the circumstances of the case. Trespassing is a criminal offense, and the court's decision to impose a monetary fine and community service is a reasonable punishment for Medina's unlawful entry and the distress caused to the Byron family. Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Shillong and Bangalore are two vibrant cities in India, each offering a unique blend of culture, climate, and lifestyle. Shillong the capital of Meghalaya, is often referred to as "The Scotland of the East" due to its picturesque landscapes and cool, misty weather. Located in the northeastern hills, Shillong offers a serene environment with lush green hills, waterfalls, and a tranquil atmosphere, making it ideal for nature lovers and those seeking peace away from urban chaos. Bangalore, on the other hand, is the capital of Karnataka and is renowned for its thriving tech industry and cosmopolitan vibe. Located in the southern part of India, it has a moderate climate, with a mix of urban development and green spaces. Known as the "Silicon Valley of India," Bangalore is a hub for innovation and IT professionals, making it a bustling and fast-paced city. It also boasts a lively cultural scene, with numerous restaurants, cafes, and vibrant nightlife. While Shillong offers a calm and natural retreat, Bangalore is an energetic city full of opportunities, making it the ideal choice for career-driven individuals. Both cities hold their charm, but they cater to different lifestyles: Shillong for those seeking tranquility, and Bangalore for those embracing a modern, urban life. Located in the northeastern hills, Shillong offers a serene environment with lush green hills, waterfalls, and a tranquil atmosphere, making it ideal for nature lovers and those seeking peace away from urban chaos. Bangalore, on the other hand, is the capital of Karnataka and is renowned for its thriving tech industry and cosmopolitan vibe. Located in the southern part of India, it has a moderate climate, with a mix of urban development and green spaces. Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: he North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade accord between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, which came into effect in January 1994 after years of negotiation. Its primary goal was to eliminate or significantly reduce customs duties and trade barriers among the three member countries, thereby promoting free trade and economic integration across North America. NAFTA had a profound impact on trade relations, particularly in sectors like agriculture. For example, it facilitated the large-scale export of Mexican fruits and vegetables to the U.S., enhancing food availability and lowering prices. The agreement also encouraged cross-border investments and the development of integrated supply chains, especially in manufacturing and automotive industries. However, NAFTAâ€™s effects were not uniformly positive. While it boosted overall trade and economic growth, it also led to job displacements in certain industries, particularly in manufacturing sectors in the U.S. and Canada. In Mexico, small-scale farmers faced increased competition from subsidized U.S. agricultural products. Despite these challenges, NAFTA is widely regarded as beneficial to all three countries, laying the foundation for deeper economic cooperation. It was eventually replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) in 2020, which updated and modernized many of its provisions. Correction: he North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade accord between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, which came into effect in January 1994 after years of negotiation. Its primary goal was to eliminate or significantly reduce customs duties and trade barriers among the three member countries, thereby promoting free trade and economic integration across North America. NAFTA had a profound impact on trade relations, particularly in sectors like agriculture. For example, it facilitated the large-scale export of Mexican fruits and vegetables to the U.S., enhancing food availability and lowering prices. The agreement also encouraged cross-border investments and the development of integrated supply chains, especially in manufacturing and automotive industries. However, NAFTAâ€™s effects were not uniformly positive. While it boosted overall trade and economic growth, it also led to job displacements in certain industries, particularly in manufacturing sectors in the U.S. and Canada. In Mexico, small-scale farmers faced increased competition from subsidized U.S. agricultural products. Despite these challenges, NAFTA is widely regarded as beneficial to all three countries, laying the foundation for deeper economic cooperation. It was eventually replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) in 2020, which updated and modernized many of its provisions.

The tail stabilizes and steers the plane (side to side and up and down movement) and helps the aircraft remain stable and controlled. The engine is in charge of providing the sufficient thrust for take off and to propel the air forward while in the air. Without this movement wouldn't be possible. There are different types of engines like jet engines and piston engines which are suitable for different kind of airplanes. The engine is in charge of providing the sufficient thrust for take off and to propel the air forward while in the air. Without this movement wouldn't be possible. There are different types of engineslike jet engines and piston engineswhich are suitable for different kind of airplanes. Each one of this parts works with the others and is mandatory for the plane to fly.

The cockpit is the front of the aircraft, the cockpit where the pilot and co-pilot command the aircraft. This is the brain of the aircraft, which has all the necessary instrumentation to direct the flight and communicate on the ground. Most airplane wings have a curved top surface and a flatter bottom surface, creating what is referred to as a "streamline." This affects the speed of the plane, because it generates more or less air resistance: in fact, for an airplane to fly, a force must be generated that can balance its weight and therefore keep it in the air. Precisely the lift and is generated by the wings. The landing gear, on the other hand, is a mechanical system in the lower part of the aircraft. Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. Response: Having lived in Spain for 2 years attempting to learn Spanish as a second language, one of the biggest challenges to language learning that I found was overcoming the embarrassment of coming across to Spanish people as "the fool" in a conversation. With all my study, and time and effort put into learning the language, I would still not comprehend the deeper meaning and function of what people were saying. I might miss one or two words. There was always a delay in processing the information as my brain had to work twice as hard. This resulted in not being able to fully express myself in everyday interactions. It was a blow to my self-confidence and I started to believe that I lacked the necessary mental capabilities to learn a second language. It is hard to go from being generally well-educated and somewhat intelligent, and being socially adept in your first language to having to be like a child in another language, especially if you have fully immersed yourself in the other language's culture and society. In the end, when I look back, it was really just a matter of applying the wrong methods to language learning. Some things were done right, but I missed out on a few key principles. The key is to be aware of these obstacles and realize that every language learner faces the same challenges. You are not alone. Nothing is impossible. There is always another way to get around a problem. If something blocks your path, just go around it, and keep pushing ahead. If you work at it for long enough you'll find effective methods which work, and then it's just a matter of applying them. Correction: Having lived in Spain for 2 years attempting to learn Spanish as a second language, one of the biggest challenges to language learning that I found was overcoming the embarrassment of coming across to Spanish people as "the fool" in a conversation. With all my study, and timeand effort put into learning the language, I would still not comprehend the deeper meaning and function of what people were saying. I might miss one or two words. There was always a delay in processing the information as my brain had to work twice as hard. This resulted in not being able to fully express myself in everyday interactions. It was a blow to my self-confidence and I started to believe that I lacked the necessary mental capabilities to learn a second language. It is hard to go from being generally well-educated and somewhat intelligent, and being socially adept in your first languageto having to be like a child in another language, especially if you have fully immersed yourself in the other language's culture and society. In the end, when I look back, it was really just a matter of applying the wrong methods to language learning. Some things were done right, but I missed out on a few key principles. The key is to be aware of these obstacles and realize that every language learner faces the same challenges. You are not alone. Nothing is impossible. If you work at it for long enoughyou'll find effective methods which work, and then it's just a matter of applying them.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: The landing gear should be retracted after liftoff when the airplane has reached an altitude where the airplane could no longer be landed on the runway if there is a power failure. Landing gear is extended by placing the gear selector switch in the GEAR DOWN position. The airspeed will decrease and the pitch attitude may increase. During the several seconds it takes for the gear to extend, the pilot should be attentive to any abnormal sounds or feel. The pilot should confirm that the landing gear has extended and locked by the normal sound and feel of the system operation as well as by the gear position indicators in the cockpit. In most airplanes, the gear switch is shaped like a wheel in order to facilitate positive identification and to differentiate it from other cockpit controls. A landing gear safety switch, sometimes referred to as asquat switch, is usually mounted in a bracket on one of the main gear shock struts. The pilot should then turn on thebattery master switch and ensure that the landing gear position indicators show that the gear is down and locked. Correction: The landing gear should be retracted after liftoff when the airplane has reached an altitude where the airplane could no longer be landed on the runway if there is a power failure. Landing gear is extended by placing the gear selector switch in the GEAR DOWN position. The airspeed will decrease and the pitch attitude may increase. During the several seconds it takes for the gear to extend, the pilot should be attentive to any abnormal sounds or feel. The pilot should confirm that the landing gear has extended and locked by the normal sound and feel of the system operation as well as by the gear position indicators in the cockpit. In most airplanes, the gear switch is shaped like a wheel in order to facilitate positive identification and to differentiate it from other cockpit controls. A landing gear safety switch, sometimes referred to as asquat switch, is usually mounted in a bracket on one of the main gear shock struts. The pilot should then turn on thebattery master switch and ensure that the landing gear position indicators show that the gear is down and locked.

Prompt Level: 12.0 Prompt: Write about how to develop leadership qualities. You can write about personal experiences or what you have seen happen in others. Response: Developing leadership qualities is a process that involves self-awareness, consistent practice, and a willingness to grow. One of the most important steps is understanding your strengths and areas for improvement. Great leaders are not born; they are made through experiences, challenges, and reflection. Key qualities that define a good leader include effective communication, empathy, and decisiveness. For example, a leader who listens to their team and understands their perspectives can build trust and foster collaboration. Decisiveness is equally critical as it demonstrates confidence and the ability to take action even in uncertain situations. From my experience, leadership skills can be developed through taking responsibility in smaller roles, observing successful leaders, and seeking feedback. For instance, leading a group project at school or work provides opportunities to practice decision-making and teamwork. I believe everyone has the potential to be a leader in some capacity. Leadership is not limited to managing large teams; it can also mean inspiring others, setting an example, or guiding someone toward a goal. With the right mindset and effort, anyone can develop the qualities needed to lead effectively. Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade agreement between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, implemented on January 1, 1994. NAFTA aimed to eliminate trade barriers and tariffs, fostering a trilateral trade bloc in North America. As one of the largest free trade zones in the world, it sought to increase economic integration and cross-border trade among the member countries. NAFTA significantly impacted the economies of the three nations. It facilitated the flow of goods and services, allowing for the reduction of costs associated with import and export processes. This resulted in expanded markets for businesses and consumers, leading to increased competitiveness and economic growth. However, it also faced criticism for contributing to job losses in certain sectors, particularly in manufacturing, as companies relocated production to countries with lower labor costs. In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which built upon its predecessor's framework while addressing contemporary issues such as digital trade, labor rights, and environmental protections. Despite its controversial aspects, NAFTA played a crucial role in shaping economic relationships and trade policies in North America for over two decades. Correction: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade agreement between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, implemented on January 1, 1994. NAFTA aimed to eliminate trade barriers and tariffs, fostering a trilateral trade bloc in North America. As one of the largest free trade zones in the world, it sought to increase economic integration and cross-border trade among the member countries. NAFTA significantly impacted the economies of the three nations. It facilitated the flow of goods and services, allowing for the reduction of costs associated with import and export processes. This resulted in expanded markets for businesses and consumers, leading to increased competitiveness and economic growth. However, it also faced criticism for contributing to job losses in certain sectors, particularly in manufacturing, as companies relocated production to countries with lower labor costs. In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which built upon its predecessor's framework while addressing contemporary issues such as digital trade, labor rights, and environmental protections. Despite its controversial aspects, NAFTA played a crucial role in shaping economic relationships and trade policies in North America for over two decades.

For the exterior of your shop, there are several issues that need addressing: - Loose bricks - Blocked drainpipes - Untidy yard - Leaky roof - Cluttered sidewalk These problems could pose risks to both the structural integrity of the building and the safety of your customers. It would be wise to repair the bricks, clean the drainpipes, tidy the yard, fix the roof leaks, and ensure the sidewalk is clear of clutter. Regarding the interior of the shop, the following concerns were noted: - Poor lighting - Lack of air conditioning - Stacked boxes - Old fire extinguishers - Loose chemicals Addressing these interior issues is essential for creating a safe and welcoming environment for customers and employees. By resolving these issues, you should be able to secure more favorable insurance quotes. Wishing you the best of luck with your new venture! Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature thatâ€™s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: In the heart of Indian folklore lies the Naga, a legendary serpent-being revered and feared across the subcontinent. Half-human and half-cobra, Nagas are believed to dwell in deep underground realms, especially beneath rivers, lakes, and sacred mountains. These beings appear throughout Hindu and Buddhist traditions, often as guardians of treasure, nature, or ancient wisdom. In Hindu mythology, Nagas are descendants of Kashyapa and Kadru and are led by the mighty serpent king Shesha, who coils beneath Lord Vishnu as a divine bed. Another famous Naga, Vasuki, was used as a rope during the churning of the ocean (Samudra Manthan), a pivotal cosmic event. Nagas are both benevolent and wrathful. They are known to bless those who honor them, yet bring drought or misfortune to those who offend them or desecrate their abodes. In parts of India, particularly in Kerala and Assam, Nagas are worshipped with great reverence, with entire festivals like Nag Panchami dedicated to them. More than mere myth, the Naga embodies India's deep respect for the natural world and the mysteries that lie beneath the surface, reminding all of the ancient forces still believed to shape the land and its destiny. Correction: In the heart of Indian folklore lies the Naga, a legendary serpent-being revered and feared across the subcontinent. Half-human and half-cobra, Nagas are believed to dwell in deep underground realms, especially beneath rivers, lakes, and sacred mountains. These beings appear throughout Hindu and Buddhist traditions, often as guardians of treasure, nature, or ancient wisdom. In Hindu mythology, Nagas are descendants of Kashyapa and Kadru and are led by the mighty serpent king Shesha, who coils beneath Lord Vishnu as a divine bed. Another famous Naga, Vasuki, was used as a rope during the churning of the ocean (Samudra Manthan), a pivotal cosmic event. Nagas are both benevolent and wrathful. They are known to bless those who honor them, yet bring drought or misfortune to those who offend them or desecrate their abodes. In parts of India, particularly in Kerala and Assam, Nagas are worshipped with great reverence, with entire festivals like Nag Panchami dedicated to them. More than mere myth, the Naga embodies India's deep respect for the natural world and the mysteries that lie beneath the surface, reminding all of the ancient forces still believed to shape the land and its destiny.

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Response: Among the nine writing techniques introduced, metaphor, symbolism, and questioning stand out as the most useful to me. Metaphor allows for vivid comparisons that breathe life into writing, helping readers connect abstract ideas to tangible imagery. Symbolism, on the other hand, enriches writing by layering deeper meanings beneath the surface, making narratives more engaging and thought-provoking. These techniques are particularly valuable in creative writing, where emotional depth and layered interpretations enhance storytelling. Additionally, questioning serves as a powerful tool to develop ideas and encourage critical thinking. By asking "what if" or "why," writers can push their thoughts further, uncovering fresh perspectives and unexpected angles. This technique is incredibly effective when brainstorming or refining arguments in analytical writing. While free writing and loop writing help generate ideas freely, structured techniques like listing and cubing provide organization, making them useful for planning essays or breaking down complex topics. Each technique has its own strengths, but the most effective ones depend on the writing purpose and style. Additionally, students may struggle with pronunciation and intonation, making effective verbal communication difficult. Another common issue is the fear of making mistakes when talking in public, which can create anxiety in speaking and listening activities. This fear often leads to a lack of confidence and reluctance to participate in conversations impacting the learning experience. Cultural differences can play a role as well, affecting how students interpret language and communication styles. Lastly, finding opportunities for real-life practice outside the classroom can be challenging, leaving students feeling isolated and underprepared in their language acquisition journey. These obstacles require dedication and support to overcome and it can vary between students. Set your goals, practice regularly and don't be afraid of making mistakes. Also, in Spain it is mandatory to sign the purchase before Notary Public, who can be helpful when it comes to understand all this paperwork. The forms involved in the process can be numerous, depending on the bank or financial institution. The amount of paperwork might seem overwhelming, but with a good understanding of the requirements, it is manageable. Mortgage rates in Spain are generally low, but they can vary depending on the bank and the applicant's financial situation. Regarding the use of professionals, it is common to employ a real estate agent to help with the property search. In general terms, it may not be easy to purchase a house in Spain, but it is worthy! Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. Response: Learning a new language is an exciting yet often difficult journey. Many students face challenges that can slow their progress or make them feel discouraged. One common issue is the fear of making mistakes, which can prevent learners from speaking or participating actively in class. This fear is often rooted in a desire to be perfect rather than focusing on communication.

Another major challenge is maintaining motivation. At first, learning a new language can feel fresh and rewarding. However, over time, students may feel stuck or frustrated when progress becomes less noticeable. To stay motivated, it helps to set small, realistic goals and celebrate each achievement.

Time management is also a critical challenge. Language learning requires consistent practice, but many students struggle to balance it with other responsibilities. Creating a study routine and integrating language into daily lifeâ€”such as watching foreign-language shows or journalingâ€”can help.

Lastly, exposure to real-life language use is limited in classroom settings. Without regular opportunities to practice with native speakers, students may struggle with listening and speaking skills. Seeking language exchange partners or online communities can make a significant difference.

In conclusion, while language learning is challenging, identifying these obstacles and addressing them with practical strategies can lead to steady progress and greater confidence. Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature thatâ€™s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: A legendary creature, also called a mythical creature, is a type of extraordinary or supernatural entity that is described in folklore (including myths and legends) and may be featured in historical accounts before modernity, but has not been scientifically proven. In the classical era, monstrous creatures such as the Cyclops and the Minotaur appear in heroic tales for the protagonist to destroy. Other creatures, such as the unicorn, were claimed in accounts of natural history by various scholars of antiquity.[1][2][3] Some legendary creatures are hybrid beasts. Some legendary creatures originated in traditional mythology and were believed to be real creatures--for example, dragons, griffins and unicorns. Others are based on real encounters or garbled accounts of travellers' tales, such as the Vegetable Lamb of Tartary, a sheeplike animal which supposedly grew tethered to the earth.[4] Some animals, such as the gorilla, the kangaroo, the okapi, the Komodo dragon, the giant squid, and the platypus, were thought to be mythical before they were discovered by science. Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: An airplane is a complex machine composed of several essential components, each playing a crucial role in ensuring its functionality and ability to fly. At the core is the fuselage, the main body of the aircraft, which houses the cockpit, passenger cabin, and cargo space. The cockpit contains the controls and navigation systems, enabling pilots to operate the airplane. The fuselage's structure is designed to withstand pressure differences during flight, ensuring passenger safety and comfort. The wings are perhaps the most critical elements for flight. Their aerodynamic shape creates lift by generating lower pressure on the upper surface and higher pressure underneath. Flaps and ailerons on the wings further enhance control during takeoff, landing, and turns. The tail assembly, also known as the empennage, provides stability. It includes the vertical stabilizer, which prevents side-to-side motion, and the horizontal stabilizer, which manages pitch control. Finally, engines, whether jet or propeller-based, generate the thrust necessary for forward motion. Together, these parts harmonize to enable safe and efficient air travel. Correction: An airplane is a complex machine composed of several essential components, each playing a crucial role in ensuring its functionality and ability to fly. At the core is the fuselage, the main body of the aircraft, which houses the cockpit, passenger cabin, and cargo space. The cockpit contains the controls and navigation systems, enabling pilots to operate the airplane. The fuselage's structure is designed to withstand pressure differences during flight, ensuring passenger safety and comfort. The wings are perhaps the most critical elements for flight. Their aerodynamic shape creates lift by generating lower pressure on the upper surface and higher pressure underneath. Flaps and ailerons on the wings further enhance control during takeoff, landing, and turns. The tail assembly, also known as the empennage, provides stability. It includes the vertical stabilizer, which prevents side-to-side motion, and the horizontal stabilizer, which manages pitch control. Finally, engines, whether jet or propeller-based, generate the thrust necessary for forward motion. Together, these parts harmonize to enable safe and efficient air travel.

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The Unexpected Coffee Shop Connection My friend, May, is a creature of habit. Every Tuesday, she works from her favorite corner table at "The Daily Coffee," a cozy coffee shop downtown. One Tuesday, however, her routine was delightfully disrupted. She was deeply engrossed in her work when she noticed a man struggling with a stack of books at the counter. He was clearly flustered, and a few books had already tumbled to the floor. Without thinking, May rose and helped him gather the scattered volumes. The man, whose name was Lucas, thanked her profusely and, as a gesture of gratitude, offered to buy her a coffee. They struck up a conversation, discovering a shared love for classic literature and indie music. Time flew by, and May found herself genuinely enjoying their impromptu meeting. They exchanged numbers, and over the next few weeks, they met again at The Daily Grind, their conversations flowing as easily as the coffee. Maya, who usually kept to herself, found herself looking forward to Tuesdays. It wasn't a grand, dramatic event, but a simple, unexpected connection forged over spilled books and shared interests. Sometimes, the most ordinary days can lead to the most extraordinary moments. May's Tuesday routine was forever changed, proving that even in the midst of a busy city, a little kindness and a shared love for coffee can lead to something special.
